word_mean: 银：一种白色、质软、可锤打且有延展性的金属，元素符号为Ag，原子序数47，原子量107.870，其化合物广泛用于医学领域，金属银广泛用于外科及仪器制造。牙科主要用于修复、制造合金、焊接、中和合金中铜的颜色以及填充牙根管

sentence.Network_en: You have to do everything you can. You have to work your hardest. And if you do, if you stay positive, then you have a shot at a silver lining.
sentence.Network_cn: 你必须全力以赴，最大限度地去努力。如果你这么做，并且保持乐观，你就会看见乌云背后的幸福线。

sentence.Network_en: He and Helen celebrated their silver wedding last year.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和海伦去年庆祝了他们的银婚。

phrase.cizu_name: be born with a silver spoon in one's mouth

jx.jx_en_mean: be born into a wealthy family of high social standing

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)every difficult or sad situation has a comforting or more hopeful aspect, even though this may not be immediately apparent

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English seolfor, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zilver and German Silber

entry.def: Silver is a valuable pale grey metal that is used for making jewellery and ornaments.
Silver consists of coins that are made from silver or that look like silver.

example.ex: ...the basement where £150,000 in silver was buried.
example.tran: 埋有 150,000 英镑银币的地下室

entry.def: You can use silver to refer to all the things in a house that are made of silver, especially the cutlery and dishes.

example.ex: He beat the rugs and polished the silver.
example.tran: 他拍打去地毯上的灰尘，还擦拭了银器。

entry.def: Silver is used to describe things that are shiny and pale grey in colour.

example.ex: He had thick silver hair which needed cutting.
example.tran: 他浓密的银发该理理了。

entry.def: A silver is the same as a silver medal .

example.ex: Britain went on to take bronze and then followed it up by winning silver in the World Cup.
example.tran: 英国斩获了铜牌，接下来又赢得了世界杯的银牌。

means.word_mean: 1. a soft white precious univalent metallic element having the highest electrical and thermal conductivity of any metal; occurs in argentite and in free form; used in coins and jewelry and tableware and photography
5. a medal made of silver (or having the appearance of silver) that is usually awarded for winning second place in a competition
1. coat with a layer of silver or a silver amalgam;
1. made from or largely consisting of silver;
2. having the white lustrous sheen of silver;

sentences.sentence: "a land of silver (or silvern) rivers where the salmon leap"
"repeated scrubbings have given the wood a silvery sheen"

means.word_mean: 3. lustrous gray; covered with or tinged with the color of silver;

sentences.sentence: "able to dazzle with his facile tongue"

sentences.en: We can distinguish between gold and silver.

means.word_mean: 银币; 银制品, 银器

sentences.en: All I've got is a 20 pound note and about a pound in silver.
sentences.cn: 我所有的钱是一张二十英镑的钞票和一枚一英镑的银币。

sentences.en: She had a silver peace symbol hanging on a chain around her neck.
sentences.cn: 她有一个银制的和平标志挂在项链上。

sentences.en: I like taking a walk under the silver moon.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢在银色的月光下散步。

jushi.english: He plated the old silver container again.
jushi.chinese: 他给这个旧的镀银器皿重新镀银。

jushi.english: The dish was made of silver, beaten out by hand.
jushi.chinese: 这盘子是银制的,是手工打造的。

jushi.english: The silver will need to be polished up for the dinner party.
jushi.chinese: 为了宴会,这些银器皿需要擦得光亮。
